FuncDef:
The dhcp max-sessions command sets the maximum number of DHCPv4 users that are allowed to access a specified board of the device.
The undo dhcp max-sessions command restores the default setting.
By default, the maximum number of DHCPv4 users that are allowed to access a specified board is determined by the type of the board.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot number of the interface board.
-

Specifies the maximum number of DHCPv4 users that are allowed to access a specified board.
For the NE40E-X3:The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 65536 for LPU120 board, from 0 to 128000 for other boards.
For the NE40E-X8 and NE40E-X16:The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 65536 for LPU120/LPUF480K board, from 0 to 128000 for other boards.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The dhcpslot-idmax-sessionsuser-number command does not take effect on the inter interface board trunk interface (the command takes effect on only the trunk sub-interfaces residing on the master interface board). Run the port-access-limit command to configure the maximum number of users that are allowed to access a network through the inter-board trunk interface.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
